ObjectName.value: Achilles Painter ARV 990 41 youth with lyra and boy - bearded man with staff (03)

Categories.value: Achilles Painter|Chelys lyres in ancient Greek pottery|Details of ancient Greek pottery|Red-figure pottery in the Staatliche Antikensammlungen|Self-published work

ImageDescription.value:
object type / vase shape: attic red figure "Nolan" neck-amphora

- description side A: youth with staff offering a lyra to a boy, both draped - side B: bearded man in mantle with staff - production place: Athens - painter: Achilles Painter - period / date: classical, ca. 450-435 BC - material: pottery (clay) - height: 33,5 cm - findspot: South Italy - museum / inventory number: München, Staatliche Antikensammlungen 2329 - temporarily on loan in: Weiden, Keramikmuseum - bibliography: John D. Beazley, Attic Red-Figure Vase-Painters, Oxford 1963(2), 990, 41 - John Howard Oakley, The Achilles Painter, Mainz 1997, cat. 54
